summary: This is a civil court filing from case 08-CV-80811, containing the plaintiff's second amended answers to interrogatories from defendant Jeffrey Epstein. The document lists numerous individuals with knowledge of the case, including victims, attorneys, law enforcement, and associates, and details the plaintiff's allegations of being brought to Epstein's home for massages and recruiting other females.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the civil lawsuit, accused of misconduct. The plaintiff details visiting his Florida home for massages.

Alessi is identified as Epstein's butler.
Rodriguez is identified as an employee of Epstein.

Goldberger is listed as an attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Defendant Serves Interrogatories
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein propounded interrogatories to the plaintiff in the civil case.

events.title: Plaintiff Verifies Answers
events.description: The plaintiff signed a verification for the interrogatory answers before a notary in Palm Beach County.

events.title: Filing of Amended Answers
events.description: The plaintiff's counsel files a notice that second amended answers to interrogatories have been furnished to Epstein's attorney.

events.title: Multiple Civil Lawsuits Filed
events.description: The document references numerous case numbers (e.g., 9:08-cv-80119-KAM) for Jane Doe plaintiffs filing suits against Epstein in 2008.

keyFacts: The plaintiff alleges she was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein by a friend and visited his Florida home on average twice a week from May/June to August of an unspecified year to give him massages.
The plaintiff states she was paid $100 for bringing at least three other females to Epstein's home for massages, though their full identities are unknown.
The document lists numerous Jane Doe victims with separate civil case numbers and their attorneys, indicating multiple parallel lawsuits against Epstein in 2008.
Key Epstein associates and staff named include Ghislane Maxwell, butler Jose Alessi, and employee Alfredo Rodriguez.
The answers are subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive information about victims and investigations.
